intro: Microglossa cabulica, commonly known as the Persian microglossa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Microglossa cabulica is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
